basics.name: Gregorius Rafael Widojoko
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: An AI engineer with a strong background in control systems, signal processing, and machine learning. I have a strong passion for research and development in the field of AI, control systems, and signal processing. I have a strong background in mathematics and data science, and I am proficient in scientific and probabilistic programming.

work.name: Eindhoven University of Technology, Eindhoven, Netherlands
work.summary: Tutoring students and evaluating their lab works on Mathematics I, Model Reduction, and Control Systems courses

work.name: Sycomora Welfare Center, Jakarta, Indonesia
work.position: Chief Technical Officer (CTO) of Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Handle an AI-based healthcare apps start up company, starting from simple chat-bot up to assisting doctors in diagnosis.

work.name: Persatuan Pelajar Indonesia (PPI) / Indonesian Student Association
work.summary: Improving and maintaining the security of PPI's main websites and servers of PPI or its countries' area's and promoting secure web developing and deploying practices among PPI's members

work.name: XL Axiata, Jakarta, Indonesia
work.summary: Developing libraries for NB-IoT ESP-32 micro-controller boards, providing IoT business solutions for X-Camp clients, and integrating IoT systems

work.name: IEEE ITS-SB, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia
work.position: Editor in Chief and Student Member
work.summary: Editing articles from Electrical, Biomedical and Computer Engineering departments and peer-reviewing articles for presentability on IEEE proceedings

work.name: ITS Marine Solar Boat Team, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia
work.summary: Design Embedded Electronics system and controller for solar boats

work.name: Department of Electrical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia
work.position: Student Research Assistant and Student and Laboratory Assistant at Microelectronics and Embedded System Laboratory
work.summary: As Student and Laboratory Assistant, I assisted students in Electronics, Electrical and Digital Circuit, Digital Signal Processing and Linear Systems Laboratory courses and tutored them to understand better on those subjects. As Student Research Assistant, I helped my lecturers researching in Image Processing, Artificial Intelligence, Embedded Electronics, Internet of Things, and Signal Processing topics for practical implementation and helped on ITS Braille Embossers Machine implementations and repairs

work.name: Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia
work.position: Teaching Assistant at Department of Mathematics, Department of Physics, and Department of Electrical Engineering
work.summary: I helped teaching students on Calculus I-II, Physics I-II, Electrical Circuits, Electronics Circuits, Discrete Mathematics, Engineering Mathematics I-II, Probability, Statistics, and Stochastic Processes, Microprocessor and Digital Circuits, Linear System, and Numerical Analysis courses and prepared several exercise questions for subject exams

volunteer.summary: Volunteering for a month in Mentawai, Indonesia, to help the local community in building a renewable energy and telecommunication systems and providing better education systems
highlights: Awarded 'Most Active' volunteer at the area.

courses: Bayesian Machine Learning and Information Processing

education.area: (Embedded) Electronics Engineering, Signal Processing, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, and Control Systems

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrodynamik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
